briefdescription.para: Whether to try grid searching.
The cutoff.
The cutoff squared.
Whether to do searching in XY plane only.
Number of reference points for the current frame.
Reference point positions.
Reference position exclusion IDs.
Reference position indices (NULL if no indices).
Exclusions.
PBC data.
Whether grid searching is actually used for the current positions.
false if the box is rectangular.
Whether the grid is periodic in a dimension.
Array for storing in-unit-cell reference positions.
Origin of the grid (zero for periodic dimensions).
Size of a single grid cell.
Inverse of cellSize_. Zero for dimensions where grid is not used.
Shift in cell coordinates (for triclinic boxes) in X when crossing the Z periodic boundary.
Shift in cell coordinates (for triclinic boxes) in Y when crossing the Z periodic boundary.
Shift in cell coordinates (for triclinic boxes) in X when crossing the Y periodic boundary.
Number of cells along each dimension.
Data structure to hold the grid cell contents.

memberdef.argsstring: (AnalysisNeighborhood::SearchMode mode, bool bXY, const t_blocka *excls, const t_pbc *pbc, const AnalysisNeighborhoodPositions &positions)
memberdef.name: init

briefdescription.para: Initializes the search with a given box and reference positions.
Checks the efficiency and possibility of doing grid-based searching.

parameterdescription.para: If true, grid search will be forced if possible.

simplesect.para: false if grid search is not suitable.

memberdef.argsstring: (const matrix box, bool bSingleCell[3], int posCount)
memberdef.name: initGridCells

briefdescription.para: Determines a suitable grid size and sets up the cells.

parameterdescription.para: Box vectors (should not have zero vectors).
If true, the corresponding dimension will be forced to use a single cell.
Number of positions that will be put on the grid.

simplesect.para: false if grid search is not suitable.

memberdef.argsstring: (const t_pbc &pbc, int posCount, const rvec x[], bool bForce)
memberdef.name: initGrid

briefdescription.para: Sets ua a search grid for a given box.

parameterdescription.para: Reference positions that will be put on the grid.
If true, grid searching will be used if at all possible, even if a simple search might give better performance.

simplesect.para: false if grid search is not suitable.

memberdef.argsstring: (const rvec x, rvec cell, rvec xout) const
memberdef.name: mapPointToGridCell

briefdescription.para: Maps a point into a grid cell.

detaileddescription.para:
x
Point to map.
cell
Fractional cell coordinates of x on the grid.
xout
Coordinates to use.
xout will be within the rectangular unit cell in dimensions where the grid is periodic. For other dimensions, both xout and cell can be outside the grid/unit cell.

briefdescription.para: Calculates linear index of a grid cell.

parameterdescription.para: Cell indices (must be within the grid).

briefdescription.para: Adds an index into a grid cell.

detaileddescription.para:
cell
Fractional cell coordinates into which i should be added.
i
Index to add.
cell should satisfy the conditions that mapPointToGridCell() produces.

memberdef.argsstring: (const rvec centerCell, ivec cell, ivec upperBound, int dim) const
memberdef.name: initCellRange

briefdescription.para: Initializes a cell pair loop for a dimension.

detaileddescription.para:
centerCell
Fractional cell coordiates of the particle for which pairs are being searched.
cell
Current/initial cell to loop over.
upperBound
Last cell to loop over.
dim
Dimension to initialize in this call.
Initializes cell[dim] and upperBound[dim] for looping over neighbors of a particle at position given by centerCell. If 'dim != ZZ,cell[d](d > dim`) set the plane/row of cells for which the loop is initialized. The loop should then go from cell[dim] until upperBound[dim], inclusive. cell[d] with d < dim or upperBound[d] with d != dim are not modified by this function.
cell and upperBound may be outside the grid for periodic dimensions and need to be shifted separately: to simplify the looping, the range is always (roughly) symmetric around the value in centerCell.

memberdef.argsstring: (const rvec centerCell, ivec cell, ivec upperBound) const
memberdef.name: nextCell

briefdescription.para: Advances cell pair loop to the next cell.

parameterdescription.para: Fractional cell coordiates of the particle for which pairs are being searched.
Last cell in the loop for each dimension.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the index and shift of a grid cell during looping.

parameterdescription.para: Shift to apply to get the periodic distance for distances between the cells.

simplesect.para: Grid cell index corresponding to cell.
